intro: Labordia pallida var. hispidula, commonly known as the woolly labordia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, pale green leaves that are covered in a dense, woolly layer of fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
